page.title: 15TRANSPORT IN EAST HADDON
page.content:
In a village served by five buses a day to Northampton it is obviously important to have a car or cars. It is a problem for many young people to find that the last bus leaves Northampton at 5.15p.m. This causes problems with regard to working and leisure.
There is neither garage or petrol facilities available in the village.
During the summer months a Sunday afternoon special bus visits the village on a countryside tour.
With just one small shop in the village shopping is difficult also for the elderly as the bus service to Long Buckby is equally limited.
Nearest rail station- Long Buckby.
